chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: So let's start with this. You see, machines or computers in this case are really, really good at certain things, right?

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: Machines can perform tasks really, really fast. And we can control these machines and get them to do tasks for us, which is what programming is.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: We program computers. We give them instructions to do tasks and they do it for us.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: You see, computers came into this world because it allowed humans to do certain tasks really fast that may have required hundreds of workers before.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: I mean, computers used to actually mean people who do tasks that compute, they computed things.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: So for example, let's say I wanted to find out how to get to Daniel's house using Google Maps.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: Well, one option is I could pull out a map and with a ruler measure each of the routes that I could take to Daniel's house.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: And then do some math, do some addition and find the shortest path.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: Or I could ask a computer to do this. Imagine we had 10 different routes. Instead of me measuring each route one by one, I could simply program and ask a computer.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: Hey, can you tell me how to get to Daniel's house? And through programming, we tell the computer, can you calculate really quickly these 10 routes and find the shortest one?

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: That's what programming is. Instead of me taking 10 minutes to figure out how to get to Daniel's house and the fastest route, I just click a button and the computer tells me what to do.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: Obviously, we have to program it and give it instructions. But once we give it a set of instructions, it just like that finds the solution for us. It computes solutions.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: And you know why computers became so popular because computers saved companies lots of money.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: Instead of hiring lots of workers, well, let's just buy a computer that does the task of 100 workers and there you go. We saved a lot of money and computers don't complain. They'll work 24, 7, 4, you.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: Now, these machines or computers are really good at things that we can describe, right? That we can write in code if else blocks to do something.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: By the way, if you're new to programming, don't worry. We're actually going to start you off from scratch as well with Python. So don't worry. This part is just theoretical.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: So for example, let's say we talk about routes. I can say to the computer, hey, if route one is shorter than route two and if route one is shorter than route three and if route one is shorter than route four and also route five.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: Well, then pick route one as the best option. I can describe that through programming to computers and computers are really good at working on tasks that have these defined rules all the way up to a game of chess.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: When you play a game of chess against a computer, we could technically have these if else, if then blocks lots of them to see how to move each piece and what the pros and cons are.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: And because computers are fast, we can just do a ton of these calculations. But then there's a problem.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: What if instead of just trying to get to Daniel's house, we have to ask, is this person angry? Let's say somebody left a review on Amazon or we're building a product that detects human emotion.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: How can I describe to a computer what angry means? Can you do that if an if else block? What about this? What is a cat? How do we tell a computer what a cat is? Let's say I ask you to program a computer to detect if this picture is a cat or not.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: Can you program that? I mean sure you can technically say, yes, this cat has fur. This cat has whiskers. This cat meows. But then the computer comes back to you and asks, what is a meow? Or what are whiskers? What is hair?

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: You see, the harder things become to describe, the harder it is for us to tell machines what to do.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: So we hire humans to do these things that are harder for us. So we let machines take care of the easier part, which is things that we can describe. And the harder things that are hard to just give instructions to, well, we just let humans do it.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: Like being a salesperson or being an artist, computers aren't good. So we hire humans.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: But then there's this new idea of machine learning. And you've definitely heard of it because it is a big buzzword right now in our industry because machine learning has a lot of applications.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: We could have self-driving cars, robots, vision processing, language processing, recommendation engines, translation services, stock price predictions. There's so many applications.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: And this is all because of machine learning. You see, things that computers couldn't do before and only humans can can now be done by computers with machine learning.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: Well, kind of. Sometimes it gets it right. Sometimes it doesn't. And we'll get to that.

chunks.title: What Is Machine Learning.mp3
chunks.text: But the idea is this. The goal of machine learning is to make machines act more and more like humans. Because the smarter they get, the more they help us humans accomplish our goals.
